intro: Sedgwickia cerasifolia, commonly known as the cherryleaf sedgwickia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant ecosystems.
